sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Angle</radical> your <radical>sword</radical> correctly at a <radical>cow</radical> to <kanji>untie</kanji> it without hurting it. This is actually a pretty tough angle to get your sword, so in order to <kanji>solve</kanji> this cow puzzle you have to be really smart and careful.
meaningInfo: Picture the cow looking up at you with her big, brown eyes. She doesn't want to be tied here anymore, so you have to solve this and untie her.
readingMnemonic: You're trying to <kanji>untie</kanji> this cow from the <reading>kay</reading>ak (<ja>かい</ja>) you're both currently in. Some jerk tied the cow to this kayak and sent it toward a waterfall. If you don't <kanji>solve</kanji> this riddle fast, you'll both go with the kayak over the falls!
readingInfo: Picture it: you're standing in a kayak with this cow, trying to untie the rope around their neck by getting your sword to cut it at the right angle. You can't hurt the cow or knock over the kayak. Can you solve it in time?!
